body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

either run in powershell
```
$env:no_color="on";pwsh  -noninteractive -Command "$errorview='NormalView';throw 'an Error'"
```
or run this in a command prompt
```
set no_color=on&pwsh  -noninteractive -Command "$errorview='NormalView';throw 'an Error'"
```

### Expected behavior

```console
Error is output but in the consoles forecolor
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Error is output in red AND the console prompt stays in red
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.6

PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: simonsabin
comments.body: Related to https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/16643 in trying to get powershell to not output ANY ansi escape characters.

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
The red in error isn't done with ANSI , see below for the issue and what's being done. 
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17886#issuecomment-1229015174 

Hopefully when it is done with ANSI then it will honour no_color etc.  (AIUI no color only applies to ansi, not `Write-Host -Foregound ... ` and error is currently doing the equivalent of that.)

comments.author: simonsabin
comments.body:
> The red in error isn't done with ANSI , see below for the issue and what's being done.

Looking at this, not sure this fixes exceptions occuring when pwsh runs such as incorrect script passed to -Command, given PsStyle won't have been set.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: This is a duplicate of https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17885, which was fixed.

title: Outputing Exceptions is not honoring no_color and leaves red color on
